Manager: Possibly loses their job if they underperform or if the business fails
Entrepreneur: Bears the financial and personal risk of the business failing

Manager: Focuses on the day-to-day operations of the business, directing and delegating to their staff
Entrepreneur: Focuses on starting and expanding the business in the future

Manager: Paid a set salary, with bonuses or profit-sharing options for good performance
Entrepreneur: Rewarded by keeping all the profit made by the business

Manager: Implements the entrepreneur’s ideas or manages people (intrapreneurs) who develop more ideas; does not have to create ideas
Entrepreneur: The creator and innovator – sees a gap in the market, which they can exploit; may continue to create new ideas as they look to expand
